meanings.definition: A supply of goods kept on hand for sale to customers.
meanings.sent1: The small grocery store always makes sure to have enough stocks of bread and milk.
meanings.sent2: The warehouse manager ordered more stocks of paper towels to meet the increasing demand.
meanings.sent3: The party planner panicked when she realized she forgot to buy stocks of balloons for the event.
meanings.sent4: Her closet was like a treasure trove, filled with colorful stocks of clothing waiting to be worn.
meanings.sent5: The farmer proudly displayed his abundant stocks of fresh vegetables at the market.

meanings.definition: A portion of a company's ownership that can be bought and sold on the stock market.
meanings.sent1: Investors eagerly bought stocks of the tech company as its profits soared.
meanings.sent2: She decided to sell her stocks in the company before the share prices dropped.
meanings.sent3: The billionaire casually mentioned owning stocks in multiple successful companies.
meanings.sent4: His portfolio was like a garden, with different stocks blooming and growing in value.
meanings.sent5: The stock market trader closely monitored the fluctuating prices of his stocks.

meanings.definition: A wooden framework on which a person is tied up for punishment or torture.
meanings.sent1: The pirate captain ordered his crew to prepare the stocks for the captured enemies.
meanings.sent2: The medieval castle had a dark dungeon with rusty stocks for unruly prisoners.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child joked about putting his little brother in the stocks for fun.
meanings.sent4: The abandoned prison still had the eerie remnants of the old stocks used for punishment.
meanings.sent5: The historical reenactment included a display of the stocks used in the past for public shaming.
